name: How to Activate New Features in EFS
title: How to Activate New Features in EFS
body:
Overview

This guide outlines the general process for activating various features in the EFS Admin UI, using the Portal feature as an example.

Note: Before adding any feature, confirm eligibility with the Account Manager (AM) or Sales contact, particularly if the request comes from a customer.

Prerequisites:

  • Customer Eligibility Check: Verify with the Account Manager (AM) or Sales contact to ensure the customer is eligible for the feature.
  • Root Access: Ensure you have root access to the EFS Admin UI to modify configuration settings.

Solution

Important Notice:

The steps to activate specific features may vary depending on the feature in question. For precise instructions tailored to each feature, refer to the dxi_installation_checklist and locate the 2.2.2 Modules section.

The following steps provide an example for enabling the Portal feature, as illustrated in this screenshot:
 

Example Steps for Activating the Portal Feature:

  1. Log In as Root

    • Access the EFS Admin UI with root credentials.

  2. Set Configuration Variables

    • In the Admin UI, navigate to System > Options > Platform Cockpit > System Configurations > Search for Module.
    • Locate the Modules key within Module: efs section.

  3. Add Required Modules

    • Add the following modules for Portal activation:
      • library
      • portal

  4. Execute healself on the Server (skip if you setup multiple modules and run once at the end)

    • Open your terminal and navigate to the EFS installation directory: 
      • i [installation]
        cd www
    • Run the following command to execute the healself function:
       
      php support/healself.php --no-maintenance

  5. Create and Delete a New Portal

    • In the EFS Admin UI, create a new portal.
    • Set the portal’s status to Online.
    • After verifying the portal is active, delete it.
      • Reason: This step allows SCSS files to compile correctly during the portal’s first activation, helping to prevent broken CSS for users.

  6. Update Globis Installation (This step is not in the dxi_installation_checklist but needs to be followed)

    • Go to the Globis installation section and add the Portal module.
    • Document the update by adding a note in the system: "Activated portal (case [case ID])"

Exceptions

  • Special Instructions for Activating the Panel Module

    • If you are enabling the Panel module; additional steps are required, especially if the installation type is set to Survey (not originally panel installation). Below steps are additional to the original steps, and are based on this article (not recently verified)
      Follow these steps:

      1. Create the panelwebsite Directory

        • Navigate to the htdocs folder in your terminal and create the directory:
           
          mkdir panelwebsite

      2. Copy Panel Files

        • Copy the required files for panelwebsite from the EFS build matching the installation's version:
           
          cp -R /efsbuilds/efsbuilds/EFS_<version>/panelwebsite/* panelwebsite/

      3. Set document_root

        • Update the document_root to point to the new panelwebsite directory. This requires a frontend restart:
          rm document_root; ln -s panelwebsite document_root

      4. Activate the Panel Module

        • In the EFS Admin UI, navigate to: Options > Platform Cockpit > System Configuration (root only)
        • Edit the modules variable and add panel.
        • Set installation_type to panel, unless it’s already set to leadership or employee.

      5. Execute healself(as explained above)

      6. Resolve healself Errors (If Any)

        • If you encounter an error like the following: 
          The following tasks failed with errors: 
          - panel_healself_jobs_902::regeneratePanelistsPasswordHashes [Warning: regenerate panelists password hashes live - without tmp table]: 
             - Query failed: SELECT uid, BASE64DECODE(u_ppasswd) AS plain_password FROM panelists. Reason: execute command denied to user 'opst_nh7146'@'%' for routine 'opst_nh7146.BASE64DECODE'
        • Execute the following commands to address permission issues:
           
          CREATE FUNCTION BASE64DECODE (sourceString varchar(200)) RETURNS varchar(200) DETERMINISTIC RETURN FROM_BASE64(sourceString); GRANT EXECUTE ON PROCEDURE 'opst_<instance>.BASE64DECODE' TO 'opst_<instance>'@'%';

        • Confirm permissions using:
           
          SHOW GRANTS;
          You should see GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION 'opst_nh7146'.'BASE64DECODE' TO 'opst_nh7146'@'%'.

Additional Notes

  • Module Compatibility: You can enable the Panel module independently of the Employee module, and vice versa.
  • Dependencies: Features such as Portal and MySight require the Panel module. However, the Panel module can function without Portal or MySight.

 

Summary:

This process provides general guidance for activating new features in the EFS Admin UI. Each feature may have specific steps, so always refer to the dxi_installation_checklist for feature-specific instructions.

Eventually, make sure to update Globis installations to ensure proper tracking of information.

FAQ:

1. Why do I need to verify feature eligibility with the AM or Sales contact?
Some features may have licensing requirements or eligibility criteria. Checking with the AM or Sales contact ensures that the customer is entitled to the requested feature.

2. What is the purpose of creating and deleting a new portal?
For the Portal feature, creating and deleting a portal helps SCSS compile correctly during the first activation, avoiding CSS display issues for customers.

3. Where can I find detailed steps for other features?
Refer to the dxi_installation_checklist under Section 2.2.2 Modules for specific activation steps for each feature.
